issue.title: parse manipulator without abbreviation is not callable

discussion.p: The parse overload that does not accept the abbreviation but does accept an offset, because the expression in the Remarks: clause:
is not valid. This is caused by deduction failure for the basic_string<charT, traits, Alloc>* from nullptr (see this link):
Status to Tentatively Ready and priority to 0 after six positive votes on the reflector.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4830.

blockquote.p: [Drafting note: As a drive-by fix the Remarks element is also converted to a Constraints element.]

blockquote.pre: template<class charT, class traits, class Alloc, class Parsable> unspecified parse(const basic_string<charT, traits, Alloc>& fmt, Parsable& tp, minutes& offset);

blockquote.p: -6- RemarksConstraints: This function shall not participate in overload resolution unlessThe expression

blockquote.pre: from_stream(declval<basic_istream<charT, traits>&>(), fmt.c_str(), tp, declval<basic_string<charT, traits, Alloc>*>()nullptr, &offset)

blockquote.p:
is a validwell-formed expressionwhen treated as an unevaluated operand.
-7- Returns: A manipulator that, when extracted from a basic_istream<charT, traits> is, calls from_stream(is, fmt.c_str(), tp, static_cast<basic_string<charT, traits, Alloc>*>(nullptr), &offset).
